_exec_summary.SummaryText:
1.  Facility Policy.  The owners, management and employees of Four Seasons, Inc. are committed to the prevention of any accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia.  If an accidental release should occur, the facility is prepared to work with the local fire department, Merrick County LEPC, and/or other authorities to mitigate and minimize the impacts of the release to the public and the environment.

2.  Facility Information.  The primary activity at this facility is the distribution of products to farmers.  The fertilizer product, anhydrous ammonia, is received, stored and distributed for direct application as a nutrient for crop production.  Anhydrous ammonia is stored in tanks designed for this purpose.

3.  Accidental Release Preventioin Program.  This facility follows the provisions of the U. S. Occupational Safety and Health Administration (OSHA), 29 CFR 1910.111, "Storage and Handling of Anhydrous Ammonia" and our State Regulations covering anhydrous ammonia.

4.  Five Year Accident History.  There have been no accidental releases of anhydrous ammonia during the past five years that caused any deaths, injuries or significant property damage at this facility; nor to our knowledge, has there been any accidental releases resulting in off-site deaths, injuries, property damage or environmental damage.

5.  Emergency Response Program.  The facility has an Emergency Action Plan.  We do not plan to have our employees respond to a major release.  If a major release takes place at our facility, the response action is to evacuate the area of the release and call 911 and all applicable emergency response numbers.

6.  Planned Changes to Improve SafetySafety improvement is an ongoing process at our facility.  Periodic evaluations are performed to assess the conditions of the facility.  Reviews and assessments will continue, and changes will be made when and where necessary.
